content.prompt: Based on the information in the diagram, which of the following best supports the claim that a change in the duration of warm seasons would result in a higher prevalence of vector-borne diseases?

choices.label: Ice sheets are melting because of increased temperatures, which is eliminating vector food sources.
A shorter warm season leads to increased competition for mates, resulting in heightened vector aggression.
Increased temperatures provide an expanded breeding range and duration, which will likely increase the size of vector populations.
Climate change has led to a decrease in vector predators, which will lead to an increase in size of vector populations.
